comments: Suggested by Legendre's conjecture (still open) that there is always a prime between n^2 and (n+1)^2.Legendre's conjecture is equivalent to a(n) > (n-1)^2. - _John W. Nicholson_, Dec 11 2013
references: Octavian Cira, Smarandache's Conjecture on Consecutive Primes, International J.Math. Combin. Vol. 4 (2014), 69-91; http://mathcombin.com/upload/file/20150127/1422320940239094100.pdf#page=74
J. R. Goldman, The Queen of Mathematics, 1998, p. 82.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=2..1000
prog: (PARI) a(n) = precprime(n^2) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 14 2013(Haskell)a053001 = a007917 . a000290  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 07 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 21 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Feb 22 2000
